poem:
Title: "Politics in Motion"

New Hampshire, cold hearted.
Trump, Haley, words unsheathed and darted.
Scott's hand unseen, yet imparted
To Trump, who once departed.
Final hours, parties ignited,
Vows of power re-cited,
Beneath the frost, heat excited,
By old songs, newly recited.
In this frosty state laid bare,
Each bet: a stake, a silent prayer.
